text.p: Mallinckrodt Inc said it is supporting its business partner, Molecular Biosystems Inc, as that company works its way through legal challenges delaying final review and approval of Molecular Biosystems' FS069, a new ultrasound imaging contrast agent.

"We believe that FS069 meets the requirements for review as a medical device because it does not depend upon the metabolism of the body or chemical action to accomplish its purposes," said C. Ray Holman, Mallinckrodt chairman.
The legal challenges were instigated by three Molecular Biosystems' competitors who have their own ultrasound products now under review by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.

Late Tuesday, Molecular Biosystems filed a motion asking the Federal District court in Washington, D.C. to reconsider a decision enjoining the FDA from proceeding on review and market clearance for FS069 and the competitors' products until the FDA responds to citizens' petitions filed earlier this year.
The petitions challenge the FDA's decision to review FS069 as a medical device while reviewing the competing products as drugs.
